intro: Chamaesyce supina, commonly known as匍匐冰草, is a low-growing annual plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with thin, succulent stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, typically greenish or yellowish in color. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. Chamaesyce supina is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
